Change Visible Palettes Dialog Box

Requires: Base Development System

On a pinned palette, click the Customize button on the palette toolbar, and select Change Visible Palettes from the shortcut menu to display this dialog box. You also can click the Change Visible Palettes link at the bottom of a pinned palette to display this dialog box.

Use this dialog box to specify which palette categories remain visible and which are hidden on the Controls or Functions palettes.

This dialog box includes the following components:

  • Available Palette Categories—Lists all categories on the current palette. Place a checkmark next to the categories you want to show. LabVIEW hides the categories that you do not select.
  • Select All—Places checkmarks next to all of the categories in the list.
  • Deselect All—Removes all checkmarks from all categories in the list.
  • Restore Default—Places checkmarks next to the categories that LabVIEW shows by default.
    Note  By default, LabVIEW installs with an abridged palette view, unless you are upgrading and were using a custom palette view in a previous version of LabVIEW. In that case, LabVIEW restores the custom palette view you set in the previous version of LabVIEW.
